title: "META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS"
snippet: This YouTube video from February 14, 2026, features Elisabetta Piccolotti discussing a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino, which allegedly demonstrates that Meta favored homophobic, racist, and fake news posts over content from politicians. Piccolotti claims that American Big Tech companies are influencing elections worldwide, and that Meta applied a filter between 2021 and 2024 that reduced the visibility of posts from official politicians by 72% while increasing the visibility of extreme right-wing influencers with racist, homophobic, hateful, and fake news messages.
description: A YouTube video from February 14, 2026, discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino that examines Meta's alleged promotion of homophobic, racist, and fake news posts.

title: Da Horizon Europe 400 mila Euro all'Università di Urbino per combattere la disinformazione - UniUrb
snippet: Article about the University of Urbino receiving 400,000 euros from Horizon Europe to combat disinformation. Fabio Giglietto, professor of Internet Studies, is mentioned as participating in activities related to the Mapping Italian News (MINE) program, which studies the manipulation of public opinion through social media.
description: An article on the University of Urbino's website discusses funding received from Horizon Europe to combat disinformation, mentioning Fabio Giglietto's participation in the MINE program studying manipulation of public opinion.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Facebook premia gli estremisti: la ricerca dell'Università di Urbino - Lumsanews
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil - Vera.ai
snippet: This article details Fabio Giglietto's participation in two conferences in Brazil during October 2025, where he presented research on disinformation and digital manipulation.  He presented collaborative research with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni that explores using large language models (LLMs) to examine political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. He also moderated a roundtable discussion on data access for researchers under the Digital Services Act (DSA).
description: This article details Fabio Giglietto's participation in two conferences in Brazil in October 2025, where he presented research on disinformation and digital manipulation, including work with LLMs to analyze political discourse on Facebook.

title: Cracking the code: social data access and the DSA's impact on disinformation research
snippet: This article, co-authored by Massimo Terenzi and Fabio Giglietto, discusses the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on social media research, particularly in the context of disinformation. It explores how the DSA aims to improve transparency by granting researchers access to platform data but also highlights the challenges and limitations in its implementation.
description: This article, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi, discusses the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on social media research and disinformation, focusing on data access for researchers.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
